sentences.english: I am allergic to sweat and hard work it’s so ‘1985′.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭流汗，討厭辛苦工作，還是和1985年一樣。

sentences.english: Having spent his youth inidleness, he is having to work in his old age.
sentences.chinese: 他年輕時不務正業，年老時非辛苦工作不可。

sentences.english: To her, team sports represent the lowers form of peonage.
sentences.chinese: 在她眼中，團隊比賽代表着苦工制度的最低級形式。

sentences.english: I don't know why I work hard , the salary just a stiver than aforetime .
sentences.chinese: 真不明白我這麼辛苦工作是爲了什麼。

sentences.english: Her husband,was a hard working man.
I wouldn't wish to have my son drudge all his life.
sentences.chinese: 我可不願讓我兒子終身做苦工。

sentences.english: Some would call him a hack.
sentences.chinese: 有些人還稱他是一個苦工。

sentences.english: The secret of success is hard work.
sentences.chinese: 成功的祕訣是辛苦工作。

sentences.english: He had no thoughts save for the nerve-racking, body- destroying toil.
sentences.chinese: 在這兒只有折磨神經戕害身體的苦工，沒有思想。

sentences.english: Tuesday was a day of similar unremitting toil.
sentences.chinese: 星期二是同樣的連續不斷的苦工。

sentences.english: People doing hard work were treated like dirt in the old days.
sentences.chinese: 在舊社會做苦工的人是被人瞧不起的。

sentences.english: These races combine fun with hard work and let you loosen up.
sentences.chinese: 這些比賽是娛樂與辛苦工作的結合，使你更加放鬆。

sentences.english: He worked by day and toiled by night.
sentences.chinese: 他日以繼夜地辛苦工作。
結果與之相反，他成爲了一個奴隸般的苦工。

sentences.english: Behold, in the day of your fast ye find pleasure, and exact all your labours.
sentences.chinese: 你們禁食的日子仍求利益，勒逼人爲你們做苦工。

sentences.english: It's wonderful to let your hair down at the weekend after you've been working hard all week.
sentences.chinese: 辛苦工作一週後在週末不拘禮節輕鬆一下真是太好了。

definition: bitter work/hard toil/(loanword) coolie, unskilled Chinese laborer in colonial times
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
to make a living doing manual labor/to give sth all one's got
